local_intent: Perceive block and goal, align and set yaw, execute a single long push on the T-block toward the goal, verify proximity, then retreat.
assumptions: Yaw 90 deg provides a convenient pushing orientation for the T-block.
Direction 0 deg corresponds to the straight-line path toward the goal area.
One push of 0.2 m suffices to reach/approach the goal in this phase.
coherence_with_global: Subtree mirrors the push segment of GLOBAL_BT with identical node types and binned port values, preserving perceive→align→act→verify→retreat flow.
